intro: Plectranthus coreanus, commonly known as the Korean mint or Korean deadnettle, is a herbaceous perennial native to Korea. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of purple or pink. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a minty scent when crushed. Plectranthus coreanus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
